_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm with auto. Shutoff at 85%, min. Class 1 Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck offloading) points w/Class 1 Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class 1 Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, flow monitoring, temperature, pressure, & liquid level indicators
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane [(1 x 60,000) gallons plus lines, liquefied and stored under pressure], blending system involving direct injection into refined product (gasoline) pipelines with bulk truck offloading.  System operations are anticipated to occur primarily during the "cold" season.

_emerg_resp.CoordinatingAgencyName: Anne Arundel Co. Off. of Emerg. Mgt

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



Kinder Morgan Liquids Terminals, LLC - Kinder Morgan Curtis Bay is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations. This Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the Butane Blending System, including the associated piping and one 60,000 gallon butane storage vessels.  KMLT owns the real property associated with the Butane Blending System. Energy Transfer LP owns all the equipment associated with the Butane Blending System.  Energy Transfer LP and KMLT each have operational responsibilities for the Butane Blending System.   Energy Transfer LP controls and monitors all butane blending operations remotely from its control center located near Houston, Texas, conducts all maintenance activities, and schedules the delivery of butane trucks.  KMLT oversees the unloading of butane trucks into the storage vessel and conducts routine visual inspections.



Energy Transfer LP (Sunoco at the time of construction) constructed the Butane Blending System in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) No. 58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage. Energy Transfer LP designed, constructed, and maintains the Butane Blending System, in accordance with NFPA No. 58 and the manufacturer's instructions and recommendations.



It is the Parties' policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws/codes. If an emergency were to occur, it is the Parties' policy to notify the Anne Arundel County Fire Department as well as the Anne Arundel County Office of Emergency Management. Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Management Services and the Harbor Hospital, Baltimore, Maryland, which is the nearest full service hospital/emergency department.





Kinder Morgan Curtis Bay has evaluated and reported a worst-case release scenario and an alternative, more credible, scenario.



The Parties comply with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident

Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard and associated 14 elements (29 CFR Part 1910.119), and all applicable state and local laws and regulations.  This facility has not had an accident

Involving butane which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.



In the event of an emergency involving the Butane Blending System, it is the Parties' policy to initially contact the owner of the equipment - Energy Transfer LP and the local fire department. The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with the local fire department. Anne Arundel County Fire Department personnel have participated in the initial RMP/PSM training session for this system.



Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point pneumatic valve feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), 85% fill shut-off (80% alarm and 90% ESD actuation) on the vessels, emergency shut-off devices on the system and video display terminal, line thermal/hydrostatic reliefs, and grounding interlock devices.  Additional vessel protection includes an intumescent coating.  Note: In contrast to the PSM requirements, this "stationary source" as defined under 40

CFR Part 68 is bounded by the off-load station and the points of injection.



The Parties actively seek employee input on process safety improvements. Additionally, the Anne Arundel County Fire Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills. Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion.
